description: Projects based on the csWeb framework are very configurable. Most configuration is done in the project.json file, and this is the schema that belongs to it.
title: Schema for csWeb-based projects.

___eventTab.description: If true, show the event tab.

___dashboards.description: Dashboards or tabs in the navigation menu, used to describe the separate views.

___showBackgroundImage.description: If true (default false), show a background image (e.g. instead of the map).

___showLegend.description: If true (default false), show a legend.

___widgets.description: Widgets display additional content, such as a legend, text (in markdown), grahps etc..

___top.description: Distance in pixels to the top border.

___enabled.description: If true (default), the widget is enabled.

___directive.description: Name of the widget (e.g. agenda, button, chart, etc.).

___right.description: Distance in pixels to the right border.

___left.description: Distance in pixels to the left border.

___showLeftmenu.description: If true (default), show the left menu when opening the dashboard.

___mobile.description: If true (default false), also show on mobile.

___visiblelayers.description: List of layer IDs that should be visible when the dashboard is activated.

___name.description: Name as displayed in the navbar.

___mapWidth.description: Specify the width of the map.

___alignMapRight.description: If false (default), align the map to the left.

___showRightmenu.description: If true (default false), show the right menu when opening the dashboard.

___title.description: Title of the project as displayed in the navigation bar.

___expertMode.description: If true (default false), determines what the user sees (e.g. timeline is for experts).

___searchProviders.description: Search providers to lookup addresses online.

___data.description: Additional properties to append to the query.

___focus.description: Current focus time in JavaScript time ticks.

___enablePlay.description: When true, add a play button to the timeline focus

___enableEvents.description: When true, show events on the timeline.

___range.description: Alternatively, specify the initial time range.

___groups.description: Group the map layers: layers in a group share the filter and style property, and, if enabled, are clustered together.

___clusterLevel.description: Cluster features starting at this zoom level, only applicable when clustering is true.

___oneLayerActive.description: If true (default false), you can only select one layer at a time (radio button instead of checkboxes). Typically used for layers that overlap each other.

___languages.description: For localization, specify the languages that you support

___clustering.description: If true, clusters features at a specific zoom level (the clusterLevel).

___layers.description: Layers that are part of the group (and that share the filter, style and cluster settings).

___opacity.description: Opacity of the layer between 0 (transparent) and 100 (opaque).

___type.description: Source type, e.g. dynamicgeojson (is synched with a server), editablegeojson (is editable but not synched).

___tags.description: Rarely used, sometimes for describing a layer and filtering features (e.g. in the Kanban board)

___timeAware.description: If true, listen and recalculate the layer when the time changes. As this is an expensive operation, preferably only use it for layers with few features or turn it off.

___isEditable.description: If true (default false), the layer can be edited.

___typeUrl.description: Resource type URL, i.e. where to find the description of the layer. A resource type describes for each feature the look-and-feel, e.g. icon, icon size, properties to show and their name and formatting.

___dataSourceParameters.description: List of properties that is used to convert the data source.

___defaultFeatureType.description: Specify the default feature type that we use (specified in the resource type/typeUrl). If none is given, we assume that the feature contains a property featureTypeId, which is the name of the feature type in resource type file.

___url.description: URL where to find the data.

___isDynamic.description: If true (default false), the layer can be updated externally (e.g. via MQTT or REST call to the API manager)

___renderType.description: Render type, i.e. how to render the map layer. Default is geojson.

___logo.description: The project logo as displayed in the navigation bar.

___url.description: (External) URL of the project as used in the navigation bar.

___isDynamic.description: When true, the project may be updated dynamically, i.e. receive notifications via Socket.io.

___viewBounds.description: When loading the web app, zoom the map to within these bounds.

___criteria.description: List of criteria to use for the MCA

___weight.description: Computed weight, based on specified user weight, but make sure that the sum of all weights is 1.

___stringFormat.description: Similar to the string format used in .NET and in the property types.

___isPlaScaled.description: Internal property: Is the PLA scaled.

___isPlaUpdated.description: Internal property: is the PLA (Piecewise-Linear Approximation) updated.

___label.description: Label to use for the new calculated property (starts with mca_).

___featureIds.description: List of feature IDs to use.

___id.name: id
___id.description: The project id is used when the solution (website) has multiple projects, e.g. one for each user role.
___id.title: Id of the project.

___expertMode.description: If true (default false), the user is allowed to create new MCA criteria.
